heading: Solved1 ISS 2021 (Paper I)

Consider following next three items follow:Let point p.d.f. X Y \[f(x) = \left\{ \begin{matrix}
6(1 - x - y),\ \ \ x > 0,\ y > 0,\ x + y < 1 \\
0,\ \ \ otherwise \\
\end{matrix} \right.\ \]1. value E(XY)?) 10 b) 20 c) \(\frac{1}{10}\) d) \(\frac{1}{20}\)Solution:\(E(XY) = \ \int_{0}^{1}{\int_{0}^{1 - x}{xy\ 6(1 - x - y)dy\ dx}}\)\(= 6\int_{0}^{1}{\int_{0}^{1 - x}{xy\ (1 - x - y)dy\ dx}}\ \)\(= 6\int_{0}^{1}{\lbrack\frac{xy^{2}}{2}} - \ \frac{x^{2}y^{2}}{2} - \ \frac{xy^{3}}{3}\)]
dx\(= 6\int_{0}^{1}{x{(1 - x)}^{2}\lbrack\frac{1}{2}} - \ \frac{x}{2} - \ \frac{1 - x}{3}\rbrack\ dx\ \)\(= 6\int_{0}^{1}{(x - 3x^{2} + 3x^{3}} - x^{4})\ dx\)\(= 6\lbrack\frac{x^{2}}{2} - \ \frac{3x^{3}}{3} + \frac{3x^{4}}{4} - \frac{x^{5}}{5}\rbrack\)\(=\frac{1}{2} - \ 1 + \frac{3}{4} - \ \frac{1}{5}\)\(= \frac{1}{20}\)Option D correct2. value Cov(X, Y)?) \(\frac{1}{40}\) b) \(\frac{1}{80}\) c) \(\frac{- 1}{40}\) d)\(\frac{- 1}{80}\)Solution:\(E(X) = \ \int_{}^{}{x\ f(x)dx}\)\({f}_{x}(x) = 6\int_{0}^{1 - y}{\left\lbrack (1 - x) - y \right)dy}\)\(= 6\lbrack(1 - x)y - \ \frac{y^{2}}{2}\)]\(= 6\lbrack(1 - x)^{2} - \frac{(1 - x)^{2}}{2}\rbrack\)= \(3\ {(1 - x)}^{2}\) \(0 \leq x < 1\)\(E(X) = \int_{0}^{1}{x\ 3{(1 - x)}^{2}}\ dx\)= \(3\ \int_{0}^{1}{x\ {(1 - x)}^{2}\ dx}\)= 3 \(\beta(2,3)\)= \(\frac{1}{4}\)\({f}_{y}(y) = 3{(1 - y)}^{2}\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ 0 \leq y \leq 1\)\(E(Y) = \ \frac{1}{4}\)\(Cov(X,Y) =E(XY) - E(X) E(Y)\)\(= \frac{1}{20} - \ \frac{1}{4}\  \times \frac{1}{4}\) = \(\frac{- 1}{80}\)Option D correct3. equation line regression X Y?) \(X = (3-5Y)/15\) b) \(X = (1-Y)/3\) c) \(X=(5-3Y)/15\) d) \(X=(1-Y)/5\)Solution:\(X = E\left( \frac{X}{Y = y} \right)\)\(f\left( \frac{x}{y} \right) = \ \frac{f(x,y)}{f(y)}\)\(=\frac{6(1 - x - y)}{3{(1 - y)}^{2}}\)\(E(\frac{X}{Y}) = \ \int_{0}^{1 - y}{x\ f(\frac{x}{y}})\ dx\)\(= \ 2\int_{0}^{1 - y}{x\ \frac{(1 - x - y)}{{(1 - y)}^{2}}}\ dx\)=\(\frac{2}{(1 - y)^{2}\ }\left\lbrack \frac{x^{2}}{2} - \ \frac{x^{3}}{3} - \ \frac{x^{2}y}{2} \right\rbrack\)\(= \ \frac{2}{(1 - y)^{2}\ }(1 - y)^{3}(\frac{1}{2} - \ \frac{1}{3})\)= \(\frac{(1 - y)}{3}\)Option B correctConsider following next two items follow:Let joint density function X Y \[f(x) = \left\{ \begin{matrix}
8xy,\ \ \ 0 < x < y < 1 \\
0,\ \ \ otherwise \\

\(\frac{8xy}{\int_{x}^{1}{8xy\ dy}}\) = \(\frac{2y}{1 - x^{2}}\)\(E\left( \frac{Y}{X = x} \right) = \int_{x}^{1}\frac{2y^{2}}{1 - x^{2}}\ dy\)= \(\frac{2}{3(1 - x^{2})}\ (1 - x^{3})\)Option C correct5. value \([Y^2|x=0.5~]\)?) \(0.5\) b) \(0.525\) c) \(0.6\) d) \(0.625\)Solution:\([Y^2|x=0.5]\) =
\(\int_{}^{}y^{2}\ f\left( \frac{y}{x} \right) = \ \int_{x}^{1}{y^{2}\ \frac{2y}{1 - x^{2}}}\ dy = \ \frac{2}{1 - x^{2}}\ \int_{x}^{1}{y^{3}\ dy = \ \frac{\left( 1 - x^{4} \right)}{2\left( 1 - x^{2} \right)}} = \ \frac{1 + x^{2}}{2} = 0.625\)Option D correct6. large sample must taken order probability least 0.95 sample mean within 0.5 neighbourhood population mean, provided population standard deviation 1?) \(80~~\)b) \(79~~\) c) \(74~~\) d) \(Canno~~determined\)Solution:Using Chebychev’s inequality,\(P\left\lbrack \left| {\overline{X}}_{n} - \mu \right| < \ \varepsilon \right\rbrack \geq 1 - \frac{\sigma^{2}}{n\varepsilon^{2}}\)

\(\frac{247}{256}\)Solution:\(f\left( x_{} \right) = \ \frac{x!}{(x - )!(- 1)!}\ \left\{ F\left( X_{} \right) \right\}^{= 1}\left\lbrack 1 - F\left( X_{} \right) \right\rbrack^{n - }f(x)\)n= 4 =3\(F(x) = \ \int_{0}^{x}{2x\ dx = \ x^{2}}\)\(\ \ \ \ f\left( x_{3} \right) = \ \frac{4!}{1!2!}\ {\lbrack F\left( x_{3} \right)\rbrack}^{2}\ \left( 1 - F\left( x_{3} \right) \right)f(x_{4})\)]= \(12\left( x^{2} \right)\left( 1 - x^{2} \right)2x\)= \(24\left( x^{5} \right)\left( 1 - x^{2} \right)\)\(P\left\lbrack \frac{1}{2}\  < \ x_{3} \right\rbrack = \ \int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1}{24x^{5}}\left( 1 - x^{2} \right)dx = \frac{243}{256}\)Option B correct12. statements /correct?) \(1~~~\) b) \(2~~~\) 3) \(~1~~2~~\) 4) \(Neither~1~~2\)Solution:\((X,Y)\sim BVN(\mu_{1},\ \mu_{2},\sigma_{1}^{2},\ \sigma_{2}^{2},\rho)\)\(M_{(X,Y)}\left( t_{1},t_{2} \right) = E(e^{t_{1}X + t_{2}Y)}\)\({\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = e}^{t_{1}\mu_{1 + t_{2}\mu_{2 +}}}\frac{1}{2}(t_{1}\sigma_{1}^{2} + t_{2}\sigma_{2}^{2}) + 2\rho t_{1}t_{2}\sigma_{1}\sigma_{2}\)

Let random variables X Y joint p.d.f \(f(x,y) = \frac{1}{3}(x + y);0 \leq x \leq 1,\ \ 0 \leq y \leq 2.\ \ \).value E(XY)?) \(\frac{2}{3}~~\) b) \(\frac{5}{3}~~\) c) \(\frac{2}{9}~~\) d) \(\frac{5}{9}\)Solution:\(E(X,Y) = \int_{0}^{1}{\int_{0}^{2}{xy\ f(x,y)dy\ dx}}\)\(\ \ \ \ \ \  = \frac{1}{3}\int_{0}^{1}{\int_{0}^{2}{(x^{2}}}y + xy^{2})\ dy\ dx\)\(\ \ \ \ \ \  = \frac{1}{3}\int_{0}^{1}{(2x^{2}} + \frac{8x}{3})\ dx\)\(\ \ \ \ \ \ = \frac{2}{3}\)Option correct17. x standard normal variate, third degree orthogonal
polynomial isa) \(x^{3} + x^{2} - 1~~\) b) \(x^{3} + 3x + 4~~\) c) \(x^{3} - 3x~~\) d) \(x^{3} + x^{2}\)-6Option C correctConsider following next three items follow:Let (X,Y) follow Bivariate Normal distribution joint p.d.f\(f(x,y) = k\exp\left\lbrack \frac{- 8}{27}\ {\{(x - 7)}^{2} - 2(x - 7)(y + 5) + 4(y + 5)^{2} \right\},(x,y) \\mathbb{R}^{2}\rbrack\ \ \ \)18. values V(X) V(Y) respectively?) \(\frac{9}{4}\)\(\frac{9}{16}~~\) b) \(\frac{9}{16}\)\(\frac{9}{32}~~\) c) \(\frac{9}{4}\)\(\frac{9}{32}~~\) d) \(\frac{9}{16}\)\(\frac{9}{16}\)Solution:\(f(x,y) = k\exp\left\lbrack \frac{- 8}{27}\ {\{(x - 7)}^{2} - 2(x - 7)(y + 5) + 4(y + 5)^{2} \right\}\)\(f(x,y) = k\exp\left\lbrack \frac{- 1}{2}\ {\{\frac{16}{27}(x - 7)}^{2} - 2 \times \frac{16}{27}(x - 7)(y + 5) + \frac{16 \times \ 4}{27}(y + 5)^{2} \right\}\) ……….(1)\(f(x,y) = \frac{1}{2\pi\sigma_{1}\sigma_{2\ }\sqrt{1 - \rho^{2}}}\exp{\{\frac{- 1}{\ 2\ }}\frac{{(x - \mu_{1\ })}^{2}}{\sigma_{1}^{2}\ (1 - \rho^{2})}\) +
\(frac{{(y - \mu_{2\ })}^{2}}{\sigma_{2}^{2}\ (1 - \rho^{2})} - \ \frac{2\rho\left( x - \mu_{1} \right)(y - \mu_{2})}{\sigma_{1}\sigma_{2}(1 - \rho^{2})}\}\) …………..(2)(1)& (2), \(\mu_{1\ }{= 7\ \ \ \ \ \mu}_{2\ } = \  - 5\)\({\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \sigma}_{1}^{2}\ \left( 1 - \rho^{2} \right) = \frac{27}{16}\ {\ldots\ldots\ldots..(3)\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \sigma}_{2}^{2}\ \left( 1 - \rho^{2} \right) = \frac{27}{64}\ \ \ \ \ \ \)
……….. (4)\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \frac{\rho}{\sigma_{1}\sigma_{2}(1 - \rho^{2})} = \ \frac{16}{27}\)
………….(5)(3) & (4), \(\sigma_{1}\sigma_{2\ }(1 - \rho^{2}) = \frac{27}{32}\ \)(5)\(\rightarrow\) \(\frac{\rho}{\frac{27}{32}} = \ \frac{16}{27}\)\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \rho = \ \frac{1}{4}\)Substituting (3) & (4),\({\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \sigma}_{1}^{2}\ \left( 1 - \frac{1}{4} \right)\  = \frac{27}{16}\)
\(\sigma_{2}^{2}\ \left( 1 - \frac{1}{4} \right)\  = \frac{27}{64}\)\({\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \sigma}_{1}^{2} = \frac{9}{4}\)
\({\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \sigma}_{2}^{2} = \frac{9}{16}\)Option correct19. approximate value k?Solution:\(\frac{1}{2\pi\sigma_{1}\sigma_{2\ }\sqrt{1 - \rho^{2}}}\) = k\({\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \sigma}_{1} = \frac{3}{2}\) ,
\(\sigma_{2} = \frac{3}{4}\) , \(\rho = \ \frac{1}{2}\)\(k = \frac{1}{2\pi\  \times \frac{3}{2}\  \times \frac{3}{4} \times \ \sqrt{1 - \frac{1}{4}}}\)
= \(\frac{0.51}{\pi}\)Option C correct20. line regression Y X?) \(Y= 6.75X-0.25~~\) b) \(Y= 0.25X-6.75~~\) c) \(Y= 6.25X+0.45~~\) d) \(Y= 6.25X+6.75\)Solution:\(\ \ Y - \overline{Y} = \ \frac{r\ \sigma_{y}}{\sigma_{x}}\ (X - \overline{X}\ )\)\(\ \ Y - ( - 5) = \ \frac{1}{2}\frac{\ \frac{3}{4}}{\frac{3}{2}}\ (X - 7\ )\)\(\ \ Y + 5 = \ \frac{1}{4}\ (X - 7\ )\)\(\ \ Y + 5 = \ \frac{X}{4}\  - \frac{7\ }{4}\)\(\ \ Y = \frac{X - 27}{4}\)\(\ \  Y = 0.25X - 6.75\ \)Option B correct21. \(\{ x_{n}:n \geq 1\}\) sequence independent indetically distributed random variables mean \(\frac{1}{2}\), probability event \(\left\{ \left| x_{n} \right| > \frac{n}{2}\ \ infinitely\ many\ n \right\}.\)) \(~equal~~0~~\) b) \(~equal~~\)\(\frac{1}{2}~~\) c) \(lies~strictly~\) \(\frac{1}{2}~~\)\(~1~~\) d) \(~equal~~1~~\)Solution:\({\ \ \ \ \ X}_{}\ iid\ R.V\)\(\ \ \ \ E\left( X_{} \right) = \frac{1}{2}\)\(P\left( \left| X_{n} \right| > \frac{n}{2} \right) = 1 - P\left\lbrack \left| X_{n} \right| \leq \frac{n}{2} \right\rbrack\)\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = 1 - P\lbrack\frac{- n}{2}\  \leq \ X_{n} \leq \frac{n}{2}\)]\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ =1 - P\lbrack\frac{- (n + 1)}{2\sigma}\rbrack \leq \ Z \leq \frac{n - 1}{2\sigma}\)]\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ =\ 1 - \{\phi\left\lbrack \frac{(n - 1)}{2\sigma} \right\rbrack - \phi\lbrack\frac{- (n + 1)}{2\sigma}\)]
}\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ =\ 1 - \phi\left\lbrack \frac{(n - 1)}{2\sigma} \right\rbrack - \phi\lbrack\frac{- (n + 1)}{2\sigma}\)]\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = 1 - \phi\left\lbrack \frac{(1 - n)}{2\sigma} \right\rbrack - \phi\lbrack\frac{- (n + 1)}{2\sigma}\)]\(\underset{n \rightarrow \infty}{\ \ \ \ \ \ lim}{P\{|X_{n}| > \frac{n}{2}}\} = \lim_{n \rightarrow \infty}\phi\left\lbrack \frac{(1 - n)}{2\sigma} \right\rbrack - \phi\lbrack\frac{- (n + 1)}{2\sigma}\)]
= \(\phi( - \infty) + \phi( - \infty) = 0\)Option correct22. Suppose n natural number random variable Y distributed {-n, -n+1,…., -1, 0, 1, 2 , 3,…..,n-1,n} property every k \(\\) {1, 2, 3, …..,n}, Prob (Y= k) = 2 Prob(Y = -k) > 0. y \(\\left\{ 1,\ 4,\ 9,\ \ldots\ldots,n^{2} \right),\ E\left( Y \middle| Y^{2} = y \right)\) equal toa) \(- \sqrt{\frac{y}{3}}~~\) b) \(- \sqrt{\frac{y}{2}}~~\) c)
\(\sqrt{\frac{y}{3}}~~\) d) \(\frac{y}{2}\)Solution:\(P\lbrack Y = k\rbrack = 2\ Prob(Y\  = \  - k)\)\(E\left\lbrack \frac{Y}{Y^{2}} = y \right\rbrack = \ \sum_{}^{}{\pm \ \sqrt{y}}\ P\lbrack y = \pm \sqrt{y}/\ y^{2} = y\rbrack\)     =\(\sum_{}^{}{\{\ \sqrt{y}}\ P\left\lbrack y = {\sqrt{y}\ /y}^{2} = y \right\rbrack + \  - \sqrt{y}\ P\lbrack y = - \sqrt{y}/\ y^{2} = y\rbrack\)     =\(\sum_{}^{}\frac{\sqrt{y}\ P(y = \sqrt{y})}{P\left( y = \sqrt{y} \right) + \ P(y = - \sqrt{y})}\) -\(\frac{\sqrt{y}\ P(y = \sqrt{y})}{P\left( y = \sqrt{y} \right) + \ P(y = - \sqrt{y})}\)\(\therefore P\lbrack Y = k\rbrack = 2\ P(Y\  = \  - k)\) \(\ \)\(\ \ \ \ = \sum_{}^{}\frac{\sqrt{y}\ P(y = \sqrt{y})}{P\left( y = \sqrt{y} \right) + \ P(y)dy}\) -
\(\sqrt{y}\ \frac{1}{2}\frac{P(y = \sqrt{y})}{P\left( y = \sqrt{- y} \right) + \ P(y = \sqrt{y})dy}\)\(= \sum_{}^{}\frac{2\sqrt{y}\ P(y = \sqrt{y})}{3\ P\left( y = \sqrt{y} \right)}\) - \(\ \frac{2}{2}\frac{\sqrt{y}P(y = \sqrt{y})}{3\ P\left( 3 - \sqrt{y} \right)}\)\(\ \ \ \ = \frac{2}{3}\ \sqrt{y} - \ \frac{\sqrt{y}}{3}\ \)\(\ \ \ \ = \ \frac{\sqrt{y}}{3}\ \)Option C correct23. E(X2) equal toa) \(17~~\) b) \(37~~\) c) \(112~~\) d) \(169~~\)Solution:    E(X) = 12P(2<X<22)\(\  \geq\) \(\frac{3}{4}\)\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ P\left\lbrack |X - \mu| > \ \varepsilon \right\rbrack < \ \frac{V(X)}{\varepsilon^{2}}\)\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ P\left\lbrack |X - \mu| > \ \varepsilon \right\rbrack > 1 - \ \frac{V(X)}{\varepsilon^{2}}\)]\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ P\lbrack\mu - \varepsilon < X < \mu + \ \varepsilon\rbrack > 1 - \frac{V(X)}{\varepsilon^{2}}\)\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \mu - \varepsilon = 2\ ;\ \varepsilon = 2\)\(\ \ \ \ \ \ \ 1 - \frac{V(X)}{\varepsilon^{2}} = \frac{3}{4}\ \)    V(X) = 25\(\ \ \ E\left( X^{2} \right) - {\lbrack E(X)\rbrack}^{2} = 25\)\(\ \ \ E\left( X^{2} \right) = 25 + 144 = 169\)Option D correct24. find prevalence virus city’s population size 1,00,000, blood test carried 200 randomly selected citizens. test returned 8 positive selected citizens. test returned 8 positive results, distribution number affected persons random sample size 500 population can approximately taken \()~Poisson(40)~~b)~Poisson(20)~~c)~Poisson(8)~~d)~Poisson(16/5)\)Solution:p = \(\frac{8}{200}\) ; n= 500, \(\lambda = np\) = 500 x \(\frac{8}{200}\) =
